Notes: Upgraded lead-in fighter with Elta radar option (120 km), 4 pylon loads for AIM-9/AGM-65, and 2025 avionics mods for datalink; Wing 6 at Kamphaeng Saen, supports F-16/Gripen conversion and light BVR-lite strikes to 100 km via Saab 340 cueing.
Upgraded single-seat with AN/APG-68(V)9 radar (150 km), 6-8 AIM-120C-7 pylons, and CCIP mods for datalink; 1st/4th Wings at Korat/Ubon, core QRA fleet for 110 km engagements via US-Thai links.

Type: Advanced Supersonic Trainer / Light Multirole Fighter
Notes: Supersonic trainer with EL/M-2032 radar (150 km option), 4 AIM-120C-7 pylons, and datalink for BVR rehearsal; Wing 46 at Trang, supports F-16/Gripen conversion with Saab 340 cueing to 120 km simulated engagements.

Upgraded single-seat with AN/APG-66(V)2 radar (120 km), 4 AIM-120C-5 loads, and Elta avionics for mid-course guidance; 4th Wing at Takhli, cost-effective filler retiring by 2031, extending to 100 km via ground radars.
Erieye AESA radar (450 km horizon) for off-board targeting and mid-course AIM-120/Meteor updates; 2nd Air Division at Don Muang, critical enabler for Gripen/F-16 salvos in SE Asian theater.
ELINT/COMINT suite (200+ km sensors) for enemy radar jamming/cueing; supports BVR by degrading IADS; integrated with Erieye for persistent coverage.
New-build with boom/probe refueling for 2+ hour BVR extensions on F-16/Gripen; IOC Oct 2025 at U-Tapao, enables sustained patrols in South China Sea ops.
